definitions.definition: To show mirth , satisfaction , or derision , by peculiar movement of the muscles of the face , particularly of the mouth , causing a lighting up of the face and eyes , and usually accompanied by the emission of explosive or chuckling sounds from the chest and throat ; to indulge in laughter .
examples: There were many laughing children running on the school grounds.

definitions.definition: To be or appear cheerful, pleasant, mirthful, lively, or brilliant; to sparkle; to sport.
To make an object of laughter or ridicule ; to make fun of; to deride ; to mock .
examples: Don't laugh at my new hat, man!

definitions.definition: To affect or influence by means of laughter or ridicule.
To express by, or utter with, laughter.

main_definition: ( intransitive ) To show mirth , satisfaction , or derision , by peculiar movement of the muscles of the face , particularly of the mouth , causing a lighting up of the face and eyes , and usually accompanied by the emission of explosive or chuckling sounds from the chest and throat ; to indulge in laughter .
secondary_definitions: ( intransitive , figuratively , obsolete ) To be or appear cheerful, pleasant, mirthful, lively, or brilliant; to sparkle; to sport.
( intransitive , followed by "at" ) To make an object of laughter or ridicule ; to make fun of; to deride ; to mock .
( transitive ) To affect or influence by means of laughter or ridicule.
( transitive ) To express by, or utter with, laughter.
